intro: Rourea glabra, commonly known as the smooth rourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
